rationale: NFR-001 establishes the local Mac environment (Node.js/Express/React/SQLite with npm scripts), providing the foundation for all code. US-009 then implements user authentication on that setup, enabling secure login/logout with role-based access. This creates a testable app skeleton: run `npm start`, log in as HR/Employee, and verify sessions. Dependencies are minimal (basic security for auth doesn't require NFR-002 yet), and it aligns with vision constraints for lightweight, GDPR-friendly local dev. Future sprints (e.g., employee directory) can build directly on this.
